data: NICU Confirmed Neonatal Stroke (Module)
Patient Care
Incubator Care
Open servo-controlled bed, see critical care goals
Temperature
Continuous temperature via rectal probe for goal of 36.5 to 37.0 DegC
Monitor Intake and Output
q6h
q12h
Cardiorespiratory Monitoring
Set alarm limits for heart rate greater than or equal to 80 beats per minute
Continuous Infusions
Ensure Total Fluid Intake has been ordered in the appropriate admission order sets. Recommended Total Fluid Intake is 50 mL/kg/day for new confirmed stroke
amino acids (PRIMENE) 3.75%-dextrose 10% continuous infusion
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
dextrose 10%-potassium chloride 2 mmol/100mL-sodium chloride 2.5 mmol/100mL continuous infusion
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
dextrose 10%-sodium chloride 0.9% (D10NS) continuous infusion
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
Medications
If seizures, consider NICU Initial Seizure Management (Module)
Laboratory
If extensive thrombus or purpura fulminans
Protein S Antigen Free
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
Protein C Activity
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
For patients being treated with unfractionated Heparin/Low Molecular Weight Heparin and showing signs of Heparin resistance
Antithrombin
Blood, Urgent, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, once
If placenta is available and pathology has not already been sent, then order Pathology Placenta Request
Diagnostic Tests
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when abnormal cardiac rhythm noted, then print electrocardiogram tracing
Consider Clinical MRI to be done within 24 to 72 hours
MRI Head and Spectroscopy w/o Contrast
Urgent, Special Instructions: to be done within 24 to 72 hours
MRA Arch to COW w/ Contrast
Urgent
MRV Head w/o Contrast
Urgent
Consults/Referrals

Consider consultation with Cardiology if there is an abnormality on cardiac examination, or if the brain MRI is confirmatory of multiple emboli, to assess for intracardiac thrombus or structural conditions that may predispose to thrombus

Consider consultation with Hematology for patients with:  - Extensive hemorrhage  - Documented thrombus  - Recurrent arterial ischemic stroke  - Significantly abnormal coagulation studies for age appropriate reference ranges  - Known thrombophilia disorder (family history, prenatal diagnosis)  - Anticoagulation is being considered for inherited thrombophilia: Hematology to consider Lipoprotein A, factor V, homocysteine at 6 months of life
Consult with Neonatal Neurology or Neurology after-hours
Physical Therapy Consult
Routine, Reason for Consult: To refer patient to Infant Development Program
Occupational Therapy Consult
Routine, Reason for Consult: To refer patient to Infant Development Program
Referral to Outpatient Neurology
Within 3 Months, Paper Referral, confirmed neonatal stroke or as recommended with EEG
Referral to Outpatient Pediatric Clinic
Next Available Appointment, SPH Pediatric
Referral to Clinic Not Using CST Cerner
Next Available Appointment, Paper Referral, Refer to Pediatrics post discharge, for patients requiring follow up at non-CST Cerner sites
Referral to Clinic Not Using CST Cerner
Within 6 Months, Paper Referral, Referral to Pediatric Hematology for follow up at 6 months if consulted during Neonatal Program admission or if family history of thrombosis
